Shares of several retail companies are trading higher amid easing trade tensions. President Trump said China is ready to come back to the negotiating table.

Shares of several retail companies are trading lower on escalated trade tensions after China announced it plans to impose a 5% to 10% tariff rate on $75 billion worth of U.S. goods. Trump announced he will respond to China's tariffs this afternoon.

Shares of several retail companies are trading higher with the overall market after the U.S. Trade Representative reported that some tariffs will be delayed to Dec 15 on some products including cell phones, monitors, and laptops.
